name: Travel Enthusiasts
title: Top Destination for Travel Services
description: In 2023, Lesotho's travel services accounted for 73.6% of its service imports, making it one of the highest in the world.

name: Debt-Free Zone
title: Lowest Central Government Debt
description: In 2020, Lesotho had one of the lowest central government debts globally, at just 2.99% of GDP.

name: Female Education Champions
title: Leading in Female Secondary Education
description: In 2017, 57.4% of secondary education pupils and 66.6% of vocational pupils in Lesotho were female, showcasing a strong emphasis on female education.

name: Industry Women
title: High Female Employment in Industry
description: In 2023, 38.5% of female employment in Lesotho was in the industry sector, highlighting significant female participation in industrial jobs.

name: Regional Trade Partners
title: Strong Trade with Sub-Saharan Africa
description: In 2023, 85% of Lesotho's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies in Sub-Saharan Africa, indicating strong regional trade ties.

name: Hygiene Challenges
title: Low Access to Basic Hygiene Facilities
description: In 2022, only 3.6% of the rural population in Lesotho had access to basic handwashing facilities, highlighting a significant public health challenge.

name: Health Concerns
title: High Mortality Rates from Unsafe Conditions
description: Lesotho faces high mortality rates due to unsafe water, sanitation, and hygiene, with 108.1 deaths per 100,000 population in 2019.

name: Poisoning and Suicide Rates
title: Concerning Poisoning and Suicide Mortality Rates
description: In 2021, Lesotho recorded a female mortality rate of 3.1 per 100,000 due to unintentional poisoning and a suicide mortality rate of 28.66 per 100,000 population.

name: Adult Mortality Woes
title: High Adult Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, Lesotho had high adult mortality rates, with 361.6 per 1,000 female adults and 470.6 per 1,000 male adults.
